column1: on the mark immediately making Rahmat play at a fullish length ball on fourth stump, defended to cover.
full on middle, pushed through to long-on to get Afghanistan off the mark.
fullish length on fifth stump at 96 kph/59 mph, not much footwork stabbing to block it to extra cover.
full and straying on the legs, clipped to deep square leg and the captain is off the mark.
full on the legs again, Imad struggling with his line here in the first over and it's tucked wide of midwicket.
full on middle and leg, driven to long-on.
touch of inswing very full almost yorker length on middle stump, driven to midwicket.
fullish length this time wider on fifth stump, Rahmat shoulders arms.
fullish and swinging in on fourth/fifth stump, draws Rahmat into a flat-footed drive away from his body, beaten between bad and pad.
short of a length on fourth stump, defended on the back foot to the off side.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended confidently with the head over the ball into the covers.
good length ball on off stump, defended with soft hands to point. Maiden for Amir.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, defended on the front foot to cover.
good length ball, defended on the back foot to cover.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, defended on the front foot to cover once more.
good length ball, Gulbadin walks through a forward prod to point.
fullish length on that fourth stump line again angled in, defended on the front foot back to Imad.
fraction wider on fifth stump on a full length, enough width this time for Gulbadin to feel comfortable pressing a drive wide of mid-off. Timed exquisitely.

full on fifth stump and almost a carbon copy of Gulbadin's drive to end the last over. Pierces the gap with glorious timing with a firm forward push wide of mid-off and Hafeez, who looks like his ankles are being weighed down with cement blocks, escorts it to the rope.
good length ball pitching on middle and leg, defended back to Amir.
fullish length angled across fourth stump with no swing, left alone shouldering arms.
short on the stumps, Rahmat pirouettes to pull Amir high over midwicket. Thumping shot!
fullish length angled across fourth stump, goes onto the front foot to defend to cover with his head well over the ball.
good length ball, flat-footed defense this time from Rahmat pushed out with his hands to cover.
hello! full and wide on sixth stump at 132 kph, Gulbadin blisters this wide of mid-off.

full on the stumps, pushed back to Shaheen who fields in his follow-through and fires back at the stumps needlessly in frustration at the first-ball loosener for four, the ball ricochets off the stumps to fine leg and they take two overthrows.
full and very wide once more, Gulbadin reaches out a long way with his arms to flay this with a 5-iron over extra cover. Shaheen getting whacked early here after terrorizing New Zealand last match.

big nick! Or is it?! Given not out with Gulbadin driving well away from his body. Sarfaraz calls for the review! Seemed completely obvious live that he edged that ball but Nigel Llong didn't think so. Sarfaraz took an eternity to review overthinking things, i.e., was it so obvious that it wasn't an edge after all? Of course it was! Ultra-edge shows a clear spike when ball passes bat. Umpire Llong changes his signal.

he's on a hat-trick! What a whirlwind over! Not the best ball to be fair. Full and angling down leg, should have been ticked through fine leg for four but Hashmatullah is out in front of the ball and his attempt to play it through the leg side results in a leading edge that balloons over Shaheen towards mid-off. Imad jogs 10 yards left and takes it at waist height in stride.
yorker length ball speared in down leg, very similar to the previous ball that snared Hashmatullah but this time too far down leg and it goes past a diving Sarfaraz through fine leg to the boundary.
full on off, driven firmly toward mid-off, Hafeez dives to his right to turn a boundary into a single.
full on middle, defended to mid-on.
good length ball, touch of swinging moving away from the lefty on sixth stump line, left alone comfortably.
fullish length on fourth stump, drawn into a shot with a front foot push to cover.
full on off, defended again to mid-on.

fullish length on off, sounded like he smashed an inside edge into his pads. Triggered by Paul Wilson but reviewed immediately by Alikhil. And sure enough a blatant inside edge is shown on review to carom into the back pad and we've had two reviews overturned inside the first six overs.
full and wide on fifth stump angled across Rahmat, drives away from his body with his hands and little footwork again, miscued back down the pitch.
full on fourth stump, defended to extra cover.
overpitched on fourth stump, sweetly timed push back down the pitch splits mid-on and mid-off perfectly to quiet a heavily partisan Pakistan crowd.
short on fifth stump, goes for a short arm jab pull, not following through and it floats over midwicket for a pair.
full and angled across fifth stump, Rahmat shoulders arms.
good length ball angled across on fourth stump, guided with open hands to third man.
fullish length on fourth stump, defended to cover.
slower ball on fourth stump, Rahmat isn't fooled defending on the front foot to cover.
good length ball on off stump, defended with soft hands to backward point.
good length ball angled across fourth stump, looks to pierce the gap between point and backward point but Shadab with a superb diving stop to deny runs.
yorker on fourth stump, stabbed out back to Amir.
good length on middle, clipped off the back foot with soft hands rolling toward mid-on, slow enough to allow a run to spoil a maiden.
full on fifth stump, driven straight to extra cover.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended on the front foot to cover.
short of a length on the hips, poor line from Shaheen and easily flicked through fine leg.
short of a length on the stumps, goes to the back foot to clip through midwicket.
full and angled into off stump, defended on the front foot back to Shaheen.
beaten! Fullish length on fifth stump, draws Alikhil into a tentative prod away from his body, late on it to draw oohs from the crowd.
full on leg stump, defended to midwicket.
fullish length ball on middle stump, two noises on a forward prod. Given not out after a semi-stifled appeal.
full on off stump, defended on the front foot.
fullish length wide outside off stump, Rahmat uses his feet to chip over Imad toward mid-on.
full on the stumps, defended back to Imad.
beaten with the angle! Imad slides this across fourth stump to beat the forward prod.
starts off with a nicely tossed up one, a touch too full, clipped to long-on
flatter and into him from around the wicket, tucked to backward square leg
flatter again, the batsman skips down the track to push this to long-on
given some more air, and gets a bit of turn from outside off, but he rocks back and slashes through point

drags it down too short, which allows the batsman to cut this powerfully. Wahab on the sweeper cover fence runs around the field, but he's holding his bandaged pinky and wincing after throwing the ball.
flatter, pushed back to the bowler
comes on the front foot to work this to deep square leg
pushed through fairly quick, and he jabs it away towards point
angled across him, quick again at 96 kph, he steers it into the off-side
oooh gets a leading edge. It's just gone with the angle from around the stumps, and drifts across him, he plays for the turn looking to clip but gets a leading edge that goes through point
innovative. Rahmat shows his range, gets down on one knee and scoops this over the keeper to get a boundary very fine

leading edge goes to short cover. This was also bowled at 96kph, but Imad got it to grip and hold on the pitch. Also got it to turn gently. Rahmat thought there's a straightforward single for the taking to midwicket, but found that he had brought his bat down too early, and the leading edge pops up for a simple catch
fuller, turned around the corner. There is no short fine leg, so they sprint back for the second. Well run
nicely floated up on off, and he's caught hanging back, defends from the crease
quicker one now, and he hurriedly chops it down towards gully
he's not reading him out of the hand, hanging back and playing him, so he's always seems hurried. Jabs it into the leg side
this time he's able to punch through cover, because the length is a bit shorter
tossed up, too full, and he brings out the sweep, gets it going nicely to deep square to get off the mark
defended back towards the bowler
fuller angled well across, he comes on the front foot to drive firmly to the man in the deep at cover
flatter outside off, skips down and defends towards short cover
slam. Down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and lifts him clean over deep midwicket. Great shot, and very pressure relieving
stays back in his crease that time and defends with a straight bat

top edge lands clear of short fine leg. Went down to sweep but Imad got it to bounce a tad more which meant a top edge. But it lands safely, though Wahab running back is able to pull it in before it reaches the boundary
strays down leg first up, and it'll be a wide
very short and wide outside off, cuts it crisply, but straight to point
down leg again, another wide
edge goes for four. He's getting it to nibble, bowled on a good length, he comes on the front foot to defend, but gets the outside edge. Goes through where second slip would have been
bangs it in on a hard length and Alikhil is caught on the back foot again, defends it back
and now a bouncer, but banged in well short and allows enough time to duck under it
back of a length outside off, steered to point
good length in the channel, defended towards point
outside edge straight away! I don't know why there's no slip suddenly, but he got it to pitch outside off and turn, drew him into the drive and got the edge. Runs away to fine third man.
pitched up and given air, driven inside out through cover
drifts it across him, comes forward to defend
full toss, flicks it but can't go past midwicket
fuller on off, flicked again, but Hafeez at midwicket slides and stops
fuller on the stumps, flicked off his toes but still can't find the gap
whistles past the outside edge. Back of a length, nipping away from the seam across the right-hander and he hangs his bat out
length ball on leg stump, tries to flick it but beaten for pace, struck high on the pad
back of a length on off stump, pushed towards cover
slightly fuller, and he comes on the front foot to steers this past backward point
bouncer, quick one, and Alikhil ducks safely under it
digs it in short again, rising up to his chest on off stump, and he gets on his toes to defend
fuller outside off, driven to cover
boom. Take that! Asghar says enough with playing tentatively, comes down the track, gets to the pitch and leathers it over extra cover. Stunning shot, well executed
comes on the front foot to turn this into the legside for a quick single
tossed up on the stumps, clipped off his toes to long-on

slam bang, six again. Asghar's not hanging back. He's reading the length well too, and choosing the right balls to skip down the track to. This time he lifts this over wide long-on after getting to the pitch of it
and well done again, good length outside off, big stride out to nudge this into the legside and take a quick single with the in-field hanging back

he's on fire!. Bad ball, too short and given room outside off, and he flays it nonchalantly to the point boundary. Didn't move his feet, but didn't need to because he was well balanced and timed and placed it perfectly
predictable bouncer as a response from Wahab, but too short and he can duck under it without any hassle
length ball across him, tucked towards mid-on and sets off for a very quick single. Fielder doesn't collect cleanly running in, so all safe
hits that hard length and Ikram is tentatively on the back foot again, and defends from the crease. Inside edges it and drops it near him
better targetted bouncer but Ikram ducks down low to avoid it
goes fuller now, yorker on leg stump almost and has Ikram falling over while trying to flick. Hits his pad and rolls to the offside
good length on off, comes on the front foot to defend.
risky single, but they manage to take it. Fuller on off, pushed towards cover. There shouldn't have been a run there but Asghar called Ikram through, who responded brilliantly and made his ground
pushed wide of point to get off strike
turn, big turn. Draws him forward again but it dips and pitches in front of him and whizzes past the outside edge
full toss, uses his wrists to turn it to deep midwicket
flipper, catches him on the back foot and too quick, hits his pad
full on middle and off, clipped behind square to deep backward square leg for one.
full on middle and leg at 134 kph/83 mph, flicked straight to midwicket in the ring.
short of a length on fifth stump, goes back to punch through cover, miscues it back to Wahab.
bouncer on the stumps, Ikram ducks under it relatively comfortably.
short of a length on the body, goes back to tuck this off the ribs behind square. They hustle the first and think about two before settling.
short on the stumps, Asghar rolls his wrists over a pull to deep midwicket all along the ground.
knee high full toss on the stumps, whipped through midwicket.
Ikram converts this into a low full toss on the stumps, by sweeping behind square.
good length ball with a touch of width, cut into the ground.
full on the stumps, goes forward to defend.
full and wide, driven past diving extra cover to the sweeper.
short of a length on leg stump, goes back to flick wide of midwicket.
floated full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot.
full on off stump, prodded toward short midwicket, Shadab dives over it to allow the run and stands up gesticulating in anger that he couldn't deny the run to keep Asghar off strike.
full on the stumps, chipped through midwicket.
good length angled into the legs, tucked behind square to deep fine leg.
big turn! Out of nowhere practically. Speared in at his normal pace on off stump and turns sharply to beat the defensive stab.
darted in quicker and flatted on sixth stump, driven firmly but straight to cover.
full on middle and off, straightens and defended on the front foot to midwicket.
full again on the same spot on middle and off, but this time goes onto the back foot to defend.
uses his feet to come down to meet a full ball on fourth stump and drive through mid-on.
sweeps a full ball to deep backward square.
good length ball on leg stump, goes back to flick off his pads but is late and the ball plops toward square leg.
full on the legs, Ikram sweeps it fine and it's cut off by deep fine leg.
full on fourth stump, Ikram sweeps on length behind square to keep the strike rotation in sync.
floated full on leg stump, keeps his hands back to guide through midwicket.
good length ball angling in from fifth stump, goes across to clip to midwicket.
good length angled in from fourth stump, uses his feet before checking back to Imad.
good length ball defended from the crease to short third man.
good length ball spinning in from fourth stump to leg stump, goes back and chips awkwardly in the air toward long-on.
fullish length on fifth stump, uses his feet and clips an inside edge that skittles through fine leg.

charges and will keep charging all the way to the pavilion! Possibly influenced by the silly point fielder in an effort to smash the ball and get him to go back to the circle, Asghar stampedes down the pitch to hammer a beautifully flighted ball on fifth stump. It holds it's line instead of turning and he's beaten trying to club this back over Shadab's head as the ball clips off stump. A promising stand ends.
good length ball, dangles the bat away from his body as it turns away.
very full length on off, pushed to mid-on.
short outside off, punched through to the cover sweeper off the back foot.

uses his feet and is beaten by a very full ball prodding. Hit on the pads and Sarfaraz surprisingly goes for a review. Talked into it by Shadab. He was hit a long way down the pitch but was struck on the back pad in line with off stump as it beat him through the gap. Ball-tracking shows... umpire's call! Umpire Paul Wilson breathes a sigh of relief. That would have been the third overturned decision of the match and we're only just past the halfway point of the first innings. Pakistan retains their review though.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, skids on and pushed softly into short cover.
quicker ball full on fourth stump at 54 mph, swept in the air but wide of square leg and goes to deep fine leg.
short and wide, slapped to the cover sweeper.
uses his feet to meet a full ball dragged wider on fifth stump. Checks a drive to cover.
premeditates a sweep to a quicker ball on fourth stump, awkwardly scooped in the air off the glove but Sarfaraz can't locate it.

the dot ball pressure on Ikram finally bursts! Floaty delivery at 84 kph/52 mph on about 7th/8th stump, just inside the wide guidelines, Ikram had to reach out a long way trying to slog this over long-on. Got more of the toe of the bat on it than middle and the ball loops in the air toward long-on. Simple catch taken at rib height 10 yards in from the rope.
full on off, defended to cover.
good length ball but wide on fifth stump, cut to backward point but diving stop by Imam.
good length ball, prodded off the front foot to Imam again at backward point.
overpitched on fourth stump, they set off for a tight run to cover point but Fakhar misfields to make it comfortable.
quicker ball at 90 kph lands on a good length on middle stump, defended.
good length again straying on leg, clipped to fine leg.
and begins with a cracker-jack! Short of a length ball pitching on leg stump and angles across Nabi with a flat-footed poke, gets extra bounce and beats the shoulder of the bat.
short of a length on the stumps again, Nabi tries to turn this to the leg side, leading edge floats over the pitch but Shaheen can't charge through in his follow-through to turn it into a chance.
short of a length again on off, Nabi goes back to guide it with open hands behind square.
bouncer angling down leg, called wide on the line.
short of a length on fifth stump, defended toward backward point.
another bouncer, this time wide outside off and called a wide on height this time around.
short on off, defended to the off side.
slower ball on off on a good length, tapped to the sweeper on the off side.
full and wide outside off, flayed to deep point
tighter line, back of a length outside off, punched through cover off the back foot
fuller outside off, driven fluently through extra cover
too short, but not rising up enough and not quick enough, easily gets on top of the bounce and keeps his pull along the ground to deep square
length ball around the fourth stump, punched back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
fuller on off, driven again, but mis-times it to mid-on
angling across, very full, strokes it to the man on the cover boundary
length ball outside off, bunted to mid-off

superb bit of timing. That's what Najibullah does. This was fractionally short on the stumps, and he swivelled to pull off his hips to the deep square leg fence. Wahab with slow legs there, couldn't reach in time
steered past point
has a bit of a waft at it, full and wide outside off, tempted to flay it, luckily for him, doesn't get a snick through. Bad choice of shot with a slip there
length ball outside off, pushed to point
fuller on off, lets it come on and guides it to third man
good length on a tight off-stump line, punched to cover point
back of length, moving a touch across, punched to mid-off
fuller length and around off, but played well, waits for it and glides it to third man
gets it to swing in a bit into the left-hander, almost yorker length, driven off the toe-end to mid-off
back of a length outside off, doesn't bounce much, driven to short cover
keeping it on that off stump line, steered to point
has a thrash at that, but it flies off the outside edge. Not connected well enough to carry, bounces twice to third man. He was looking to go over mid-off
yorker on off stump, dug out to extra cover
bouncer, but mis-directed, goes down leg.
better length, just fractionally short, on the fourth stump and nipping in a touch, steered to point off the back foot
good length again, has the batsman pressing forward but the ball bounces a bit higher and hits him high on the bat, rolls into the offside
attempted yorker on off stump, dug out to cover
good length outside off, steered to backward point's right, but he tumbles and saves
back of a length on off, but he moves slightly across and hoicks this down to fine leg
length ball outside off, pushed through cover with an angled bat
dug in too shot, goes over the head and the umpires decide he'll have to rebowl that
fuller length, comes on the front foot and glides it to point's right, who tumbles and saves
pierces the gap with a nonchalant flick. Very full on the pads, stayed balanced and used his wrists to effortlessly flick through midwicket. Was in the air for a while, but that didn't matter
fuller, driven to mid-off
steered to third man
nicely done!. This was a poor ball but dealt with well. Down leg side and all he needed was to get a tickle to it. Did that, sent it fine and into the fence
length ball on off, better line, defended from the crease, gets an inside edge that bounces near him
length ball, pushed to mid-off
short ball, on leg stump, he's a teeny bit late in reacting to it but manages to pull it down to square leg
back of a length outside off, pushed to point
flatter and full outside off, defended towards mid-on off the front foot
angled into him, clipped gently to mid-on
strays on the pads and is flicked away, but short fine leg is in place and will collect
stunning. Why does Najibullah bat so low? Pulls out a textbook reverse sweep - if textbooks had reverse sweeps - and sends it screaming to the boundary
oooh, almost did him. Floated it up and got it yorker length, he was a bit too lazy in going for the drive, late on it and it takes the inside edge, but rolls past leg stump
pushed towards cover
drags it down short and once again down legside. Another wide by Wahab
length ball, stump to stump, he stays beside it and steers it with an open bat face to deep cover
length ball outside off, he tried to nibble this down very fine to third man but doesn't connect
yorker on the stumps, but he gets his bat down in time to push past the bowler and to mid-on

caught at fine leg - what you done Nabi! Suckered into the pull shot, short ball on leg stump, he couldn't control himself and went for it. Amir was at fine leg, and he comes forward and take a good low catch.
thickish outside edge goes to third man
length ball on the pads, hoicked to fine leg

another reverse sweep! Didn't time it as well as the previous one, but this was a full toss outside off and there was no third man, only a short third man. All Najib had to do was beat him, which he did.
oooh spins past his bat that time. Wide of off, held it's line, he was pushing at it
fearless. His shotmaking is something to behold. Stretches out and drives this through extra cover. Hung in the air for a bit but over the in-field and into the boundary
flatter and into him, clipped to mid-on
quicker outside off, goes back and gets behind it to defend with a straight bat.
fuller outside off, stretches forward and pushes it back to the bowler's right
yorker outside off, gets it to move in the air too, driven back to the bowler off the inside half
back of a length outside off, steered nicely but backward point does well to tumble and stop the ball to his right
bouncer, he ducks under it and it goes over the stumps
almost yorker length on off stump, jabbed into the onside off a thick inside edge
full outside off, gets nicely to the pitch and pushes this through cover
just misses the yorker on middle, and if flicked off the toes to deep square leg
full on middle, flicked behind square.
full on off, defended on the front foot to cover.
full on fifth stump, enough width to drive to the cover sweeper.
full on leg, clipped to the man at 45 who denies a run.
fullish length on leg, spins down the legs for a wide.
full on off, defended to midwicket on the front foot.
good length on middle, defended toward square leg.
slower ball back of the hand wide outside off, fools Shinwari ahead of the ball.
fullish length on fifth stump, prods forward and a thick edge bounces to backward point.
peach! Fullish length on fifth stump angled in and holds it's line to beat a forward prod.
full on middle, defended toward midwicket.
full on middle again, prodded to midwicket for what should be a dot ball straight to the fielder but sloppy misfield by Haris leads to a run to long-on.
shin high full toss on fifth stump, whipped across the line but straight to mid-on.
full on middle, defended.
full on fifth stump, guided with soft hands through point to Imam sweeping.
very full delivery on fourth stump, reaches out to sweep and misses. Big appeal but struck well outside the line of off stump.
overpitched on middle, drives against the turn wide of the sweeper and they scamper back for a tight second.
low full toss angled wide of leg stump, Najibullah goes for the reverse once again premeditated and drags this through to the point sweeper.
short outside off, chopped to Imam at cover sweeper.
full on fourth stump, driven to cover, stopped by Shadab tumbling.
slower ball on a good length on fifth stump at 124 kph/77 mph, Shinwari made to look foolish way out in front poking at it, nearly falls over.
yorker on middle, dug out back to Shaheen jogging to his right across the pitch to intercept.
short of a length angled well down leg from around the stumps, wide called.
slower ball overpitched on off, driven hard back to Shaheen who wears it on the wrists knocking it down in follow through. Bump ball.
another slower ball yorker on leg stump, clipped through to deep midwicket at 120 kph/75 mph.
full on off stump, stabbed out to extra cover.
full on middle, leans forward and nudges this through cover.
full on off, driven to long-on.
full on off, defended to the off side.
fullish length on fourth stump, spins away a fraction and punched off the back foot to cover sweeper.
goes to reverse sweep a good length ball on middle, toe edge miscued wide of extra cover.
full and driven to long-off.
very full on fourth stump, driven to the cover sweeper again.
slower ball lands on a fullish length on sixth stump, Najibullah way out in front of it at 122 kph heaving for midwicket.

Half-Man, Half-Amazing brings up the Afghanistan 200 with a glorious square drive! Shaheen has been foxing Afghanistan routinely with the offspeed stuff but goes back to his full pace and is punished with a square drive sliced high over backward point.

Najibullah's party comes to an end dragging on! Shaheen pitched this up and went tighter to the stumps compared to the previous ball at 137 kph. Najibullah wanted to clear extra cover but no footwork really and drags a thick inside edge onto off stump. Shaheen with three scalps for the second match in a row.

starts him with a bouncer and Rashid takes a glancing blow on the back shoulder. Shades of the ball from Lockie Ferguson that pinged Rashid. He turtles a bit better to this one as his head gets just out of the way but still makes contact on the way through to deflect to Sarfaraz.
slower ball lands full on leg stump at 121 kph and is gently nibbled to square leg.
good length slower ball at 121 kph on off stump, defended gently.
good length ball on the leg stump line at 139 kph, defended on the back foot back to Amir.
good length ball on off, defended to backward point.
good length slower ball on fourth stump, defended with hands pushing hard by Rashid.
shot of the day! Attempted yorker on middle stump, Rashid breaks out the helicopter whipping through wide long-on.
slower ball wide outside off on fifth stump on a fullish length, slapped wide of midwicket.
Rashid charges Shaheen, who responds by dragging this wider outside off stump on a very full length. Rashid essentially turns it into a wide yorker playing over it.
flays a full length ball over wide long-off. Mid-off was in the ring, didn't time it well at all but safely well wide of the fielder to allow two.
bouncer on leg stump from around the stumps at 144 kph/89 mph, Rashid ducks under.

the slower ball is unplayable today from Shaheen! This time Rashid is the one left looking like a schoolboy by Shaheen, producing an offcutter landing on a full length on off stump. Rashid can't keep his hands back long enough and aborts his drive resulting in a skier over mid-off. Simple catch take at chest height on the ring. Shaheen the dream!
wide yorker speared in at full pace at 143 kph/89 mph. Shinwari plays over the top of it on fifth stump.
attempted yorker on leg stump, clipped through midwicket.
nearly drags on! Fullish length on fifth stump by Amir, Shinwari closes his eyes slogging for midwicket with his head bobbing up, bottom edge goes past off stump through fine leg.
attempted yorker is an ankle high full toss on middle stump dragged to wide long-on, but Shinwari can't make it back for the second and Hamid Hassan will be exposed on strike for the first time.
another slower ball at 121 kph/75 mph landing full on fifth stump. Not for the first time an Afghanistan batsman looks silly playing way out in front.
full on off stump at 138 kph, whipped through wide long-on.
wide slower ball yorker at 125 kph. Left alone, just inside the wide guidelines.
slower ball at 125 kph full and wide on 7th stump, slogged across the line to wide long-on along the ground.
yorker length outside off, drags a drive to long-on.
yorker bingo! Not too many No. 10s will be able to keep that out. Picture perfect pinging the base of off stump at 140 kph/87 mph as Hamid plays inside the line trying to stab this out.
strays way down leg on a good length, well done by Sarfaraz to prevent five wides.
fullish length on fifth stump, Mujeeb wafts at this as it holds it's line a touch to beat the edge.
yorker on fourth stump at 139 kph/86 mph, stabbed out to backward point.
another wide yorker at 140 kph/87 mph on fifth stump, stabbed out off a toe edge to third man on the boundary.

in the blockhole once more on fourth stump, driven to the cover sweeper and they've inexplicably not taken a run! Shinwari is furious with Mujeeb, who has apparently miscounted the number of balls and not realized that was the sixth ball. Mujeeb will be on strike to start the 50th. Or is Shinwari upset at the scorers claiming the board showed 48.4? He's voluntarily not run. A brainfade either way.
Mujeeb backs away to a slower ball on a good length wide on fifth stump, out in front slapping at it in vain catching air in the end.
another slower ball on a fullish length tighter to the stumps on fourth stump, Mujeeb out in front of it again.
hat-trick of slower balls outside off stump, this one at 118 kph, as Mujeeb still can't lay bat on ball. Shinwari only has himself to blame for the miscalculation at the end of the last over.
goes for the full pace at 136 kph and Mujeeb slashes an edge wide over Sarfaraz for four, third man very square on the rope.
another slower ball wide outside off that Mujeeb swings over. If it ain't broke, don't fix it Mr. Amir!

attempted yorker on leg stump is a low full toss slapped to long-on and they hare back for a tight second. The throw to Sarfaraz beat Mujeeb in plenty of time but dragged Sarfaraz four yards wide to the left of the stumps. He tries to flick on for a runout to deny the second run but misses as Mujeeb collides trying to make his ground. Could have been a third on an overthrow to third man but Mujeeb wasn't able to get back to his feet with Shinwari wanting to come back.
on the spot, outside off, big stride out to defend

strikes second ball!. Given lbw but the batsman goes up to review. That looked out on first sight. Pitched on a length and spun in, carrom ball, beat his defensive prod to strike him on the pad. Bat and pad are very close to together, and there is a spike. I think it's of ball hitting pad, there's a gap between ball and bat. The third umpire's thinking the same. And ball tracking shows three reds! So not only have Pakistan lost Fakhar, they've lost a review too.
fuller outside off, driven confidently to extra cover
shortens his length a tad from fuller, and Azam pushes it to mid-on
creamed. That's the shot of a man in form. Full enough to drive, he takes a confident stride out and sends it purring through cover
drags it a bit shorter because he bowled it quicker, on the pads, and flicked to short fine leg, who fumbles while tumbling to his left
snorter. Pacy and short outside off, rising up, and square sup Imam, who is following it with his hands and sees it whistle past the outside edge
nice response by the batsman, this was a poor ball, too short and not rising enough, pulled from his hips into the big gap at deep square
angles it across him this time and he lets it go outside off
brings it closer to off, but still angling across, Imam is playing inside the line and allows it to go past his outside edge
fuller outside off, driven off the front foot to mid-off
nice line, good length outside off and he lets it through again
strays down leg and is easily flicked to fine leg, who is a bit square-ish
too short again and on the pads, easy for Imam to just tickle it fine. No fielder there. bad lines from Mujeeb
better this time from Mujeeb, on a length outside off, he stretches forward to defend
too full on the stumps, flicked to deep square leg
off-spinner gently turning from middle to leg, misses the flick and is hit on the pads. Going down easily
too full and he's able to flick to deep square leg with comfort
nicely done. Babar is showing off. Length ball on off and he uses soft hands to delicately guide this very fine to the third man boundary
fuller, punched to cover
back of a length, pacier one outside off, he thinks about playing it but gets his bat out of the way
and once again, Babar and his gift of timing on show. Length ball on the pads, flicked to the deep midwicket boundary. A fielder ran after it, but more with hope than conviction
good length on the stumps, gets behind the line to defend
back of a length outside off, punched firmly, making third man sprint to his right to cut it off. They get two.
length ball on off, goes back and punches to long-on
back of a length carrom ball spinning in from outside off, goes back and punches with a straight bat to long-on
he's bowling it a tad short and getting picked off. This time Babar goes back and whips to deep square leg
fuller now, and he comes on the front foot to defend
too short once again and once again allows for enough time for Imam to go back and place his push to long-on
fuller, driven back to the bowler
angling across full ball, lets it go outside off
back of a length, closer to off, but short enough to cut. However, straight to point
nice looking drive to a full one outside off, but cover dives to his right to field. Rashid Khan the fielder
good length angling across, he waits for it and glances it off an open bat face to third man
fuller but on the pads, uses his wrists to turn this to deep square leg
fuller well outside off, and Imam is not having anything to do with that
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot to defend to point
back of a length, he goes back and punches, but can't go past point
good line, teasing the off stump, he gets behind it and defends
sticks to the offstump line and fuller balls, and Babar  happy to defend again
strays down leg that time, flicks the pad on the way to short fine leg

big shout for lbw. Not given but Naib is going for a review. I think he must have been struck outside the line. Offspinner pitched outside off and Babar was coming on the front foot to defend, but had his off-stump covered. No bat involves, but yes, it's well outside the line. Strange review, and they've lost it. Maybe they thought he wasn't playing a shot, so impact wouldn't matter?
too full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg. Mis-field, or rather a fumble, allows a second
length ball outside off, gets behind it and defends towards mid-off
outside edge goes to the boundary. There's no slip! Angled in and straightens, Imam is opened up a bit and it takes the edge to go through
mis-field by Afghan at mid-on. Full ball and driven nicely by Imam, but Afghan is right there. He makes has of it, tumbling over the ball and there's nobody behind him, so it's four.
fuller again and punched to mid-on again, but Asghar collects cleanly now. Fires in a throw back for good measure, but more out of frustration
good length and outside off, he's happy to let it through
was coming down but the bowler saw him and fired it into his legs, but Babar adjusts to push this to long-on
good bowling, on a length and spinning away, forcing the batsman to defend off the back foot
too straight that time, he gets back and across and flicks to deep square leg
nicely bowled, beats him. Flicks it off his fingers like a carrom ball but it doesn't turn, and beats the attempted expansive drive
not short enough to cut, he goes back to try and do so, under edges it back to the bowler
a touch too full and is flicked to deep midwicket off the front foot
good length outside off, tucked towards deep square leg, took his top hand off. Fielder was in deep so they thought about a second but decide against it
angling into him from around the wicket, fullish, patted back to the bowler
too short and allows him to get inside the line and tuck it off his pads to backward square leg. The fielder has to run to his left, so they get two
fuller outside off, big stride out, gets to the pitch and drives pleasingly, but straight to cover
length ball outside off, steers it to third man
good length outside off, tries to steer it, but it bounces to slip
short and wide, cut wide of the sweeper enough to come back for an easy two and bring up the Pakistan 50 (51 to be precise).
full on the stumps, driven to long-on.
full on the legs, clipped but straight to short fine leg.
nearly a return catch! Slightly short of a length on off, held up as he went back to punch down the pitch, floats just short of Mujeeb.
full on fourth stump, comes onto the front foot to defend.
short on fourth stump, goes back to punch for extra cover, inside edge miscued to midwicket.
full on off, comes forward to defend to cover.
carbon copy length on fourth stump, defended on the front foot again to cover.

full again on fourth stump, kamikaze single pushed toward Hashmatullah at cover. Direct hit would've been very very tight but charging in, Hashmatullah threw off balance and dragged Ikram away from the stumps.
floated on a good length middle stump and spins down leg, tickled fine and wide of short fine leg for a run.
full and wide on sixth stump, stretches out to nudge this behind point.
floated full and tighter to off stump at 82 kph, defended on the front foot again.
full and wide on fifth stump, driven back down the pitch off Gulbadin's right hand, which needs some TLC.
full and wide on sixth stump, driven square behind point, Rashid does well sweeping to his left to deny the second.
full and angled across the lefty on fifth stump, shoulders arms comfortably.
yorker length on leg stump, clipped off the toes wide of Rashid at deep midwicket, enough to scamper a second.
good length ball angled across on fourth stump, guided with an open face and soft hands to deep third man.

short of a length on middle stump, clipped behind square where Mujeeb is too aggressive running across Noor Ali, his uncle, on as a sub fielder for Hamid Hassan and fumbles to make sure the second can be completed safely.
short and wide, slapped to the cover sweeper.
floated full on fourth stump and spinning in a touch, smothered on the front foot back to Nabi.
flighted full on middle and off, clipped to deep midwicket.
sharp turn! Floated on fourth stump on a fullish length, Imam drawn forward in defense and it spins past the edge.
full on fifth stump, driven firmly through the covers between the sweeper and wide long-off for an easy pair.

another one beats the edge! Natural variations from Nabi as this one lands on fourth stump and straightens to spin past the edge with Imam coming onto the front foot in defense once more. Mild appeals for caught behind but Nigel Llong not interested and they've burned their review regardless.
short and wide first ball at 95 kph/59 mph, cut firmly behind point, cut off by Najibullah sweeping after covering 25 yards moving left to prevent four.
short on the stumps, cries of catch as he heaves this in the air toward long-on but it lands 5 yards wide of Asghar Afghan who was sprinting right and he can't cut it off.
googly lands on sixth stump line on a good length and spins in, easily picked off the pitch moving back to flick through midwicket.
googly again this time spinning across the lefty Imam on a good length turning away from off stump and flicked back to Rashid.
good length ball straightening after pitching on leg stump, Imam goes back to defend and is beaten, big lbw shout denied. Was hit quite high above the knee roll.
another googly on off stump spins past off and defended back to Rashid.
floated full on middle, Babar sweeps hard along the ground to deep backward square.
flighted on fourth stump, defended on the front foot at 82 kph/51 mph.
floated full on off stump, defended on the front foot.
floated full and very wide outside off, square drive cut off by backward point.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to clip but straight to midwicket.

charged and stumped! What was Imam thinking? Charges seemingly out of nowhere in impetuous fashion. Nabi darted this in quicker at 91 kph/57 mph, and much wider too. Imam essentially yorks himself on the dance down the pitch playing over the top with a wild drive. Ikram was pulled away from the stumps on the width but still had enough time to shuffle across and dislodge the bails.
full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot.
full and very wide, driven wide of Mujeeb sweeping on the off side.
good length ball on fourth stump, straightens and defended on the back foot.
quicker ball lands too short outside off, pulled across the line wide of long-on for a pair.
full and wide on sixth stump, enough width to drive at, thick edge is well wide of slip and the man chasing it down Gulbadin can't slap it back successfully.
full on fifth stump, driven to wide long-on.
good length ball spins sharply down leg, there was a noise, no wide, off the pads.

bowled around his legs! The President strikes! Nabi floats this full on leg stump at 82 kph/51 mph. Babar thought it was safe to sweep on the line expecting it to spin down leg but it's A: too full for the sweep; and B: doesn't turn! Goes straight on after pitching and clips leg stump!
full on fourth stump, defended.
full on off, goes back to a front foot ball to defend back to Nabi.
full and wide, pushed out to the sweeper on the off side.
good length ball on fourth stump and spins in, defended on the back foot down the pitch to Nabi.
good length ball on the legs, goes across a touch to clip and misses off the pads as the ball trickles through fine leg. Aborted appeal from Rashid.

quicker and flatter on fifth stump, cuts it to Gulbadin at short third man and the captain with a very very clumsy effort bending over like a 70-year-old man lets it go off his hands through his legs. Steely glare from Rashid.
good length ball on off, defended.
googly pitches on leg stump on a good length and spins toward off, defended on the back foot.
overpitched on leg stump, flicked firmly but straight to midwicket.

huge shout! Not out! And no reviews left! Quick and flat delivery lands on a fullish length and strikes Haris on the line of off stump coming forward. Impact was on the knee roll. Could have easily been given out but Paul Wilson says no.
full on off, defended toward midwicket.
full on the stumps, clipped to the leg side.
full on off stump, goes forward to defend and inside edge goes through midwicket.
good length on fifth stump, late cut straight to Asghar at short third man.
full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot.
good length ball on the stumps, goes back to flick through midwicket.
fullish, patted back to the bowler
fuller on off, played with an angled bat pushing forward, towards point
very full, comes on the front foot to smother it
googly, but a bit short, so allows him the time and width to cut it to deep point
fullish on the stumps, pushed gently but to cover's right and the doesn't time his tumble-slide well
nicely floated up, straight on off stump but doesn't spin, bunted to mid-off
and this one spins in sharply from outside off and bounces too, hits him high on the bat attempted to push it, goes towards point
fuller, worked off his pads to fine leg
tossed up full on the fifth stump, steered to point off the front foot
pulls his length back a bit and Haris pushes at it with hard hands, to cover
keeping to a tight line outside off, steered to short third man
fuller on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
flipper on the stumps, pushed through cover
good length across the left-hander, who glides it to short third man
fuller, clipped off his toes but Shinwari dives to his left to stop the ball
a bit shorter, and he goes on the back foot to flick this to deep square leg

too short and he rocks back to pull this over midwicket. There is a deep midwicket in place though who collects and throws. the throw has smacked Gulbadin on his behind, and he's hopping in pain. A hug from Rashid (the thrower) and all is well
back of a length spinning in from the fourth stump, cuts it to point's right
nice tight line and length, he can only steer it from outside off to backward point
beauty. Dips perfectly, pitches and spins past his bat, even though he had taken a big stride out to defend
a bit fuller on the stumps, dabbed gently into the off side, hands soft enough to steal a single
nicely tossed up, and he mis-read that, was early into his shot as it dipped on him, hung in the air for a bit, but fell well short of the bowler
comes forward to defend this with a solid, straight bat
fuller, drifting across, clipped from outside off to long-on
good length on the fifth stump, he plays with bat close to pad, steers to point
shorter and cuts it nicely through point to get a couple
slower, and he has to adjust and pat it back to the bowler
pulled to midwicket. Too short and he rocked back to smack this in the air, but it was safe
pushed through quicker outside off
length ball outside off, guided to third man
back of a length outside off, doesn't bounce much, but doesn't need to for the shot he's playing - just a steer to third man
back of a length outside off again and they're happy to keep nudging those to third man
slower ball, but same length and line - back of and outside off - he waits for it and pulls it to deep midwicket along the ground
length ball, a bit wider of off but Imam up to it and goes close to the ball to nurdle it to third man again
fuller and bowled much wider, forces a different shot - slapped off the toe-end but point collects
cracked. Bad ball but put away in style, too short outside off, gives him the time and room to drive with a full flourish through extra cover
that last shot forces him to bowl quicker but it's wide down leg
better line and length, fuller on off, and clipped to midwicket
similar ball, full on off, and flicked to midwicket again
waits on the back foot this time and turns it using his wrists but there is a square leg
good length outside off, draws him on the front foot to defend
nice end to the over after a horror start. Gets this to drift and dip, clipped uncertainly back to the bowler
good length and well outside off, steered to point
nicely done by the bowler, leg-cutter that goes past his outside edge. Drops before the keeper though. Maybe he did get a faint nick on that
good ball again, close to off stump and not too short, not there to cut. He goes for it anyway but connects with air only
misses his length this time and Haris can pull off the cut to a short and wide one outside off, sending this racing to the point boundary
goes a bit wider of the crease from around the stumps and angles it in off a length, defended with a straight bat

length ball going down leg, huge appeal by the keeper for a caught behind, but the umpire is not interested. No team has any reviews left, so that's how it'll stay. Would have had to be a very fine tickle if there was any. He had walked across and looked to tickle it fine.
back of a length outside off, cut powerfully but straight to point.
good length outside off, cut to deep point
fuller, clipped to long-on
length ball outside off, cut to deep point

straight to point! soft, soft dismissal for Hafeez. A bit on the shorter side, carrom ball I think, and he just slices it tamely into point's waiting hands. He's distraught, Afghanistan are back to smiling
fuller on the stumps, driven to short mid-on
quicker and shorter, stays in his crease to punch to long-on
on the shorter side again, stays back to punch to long-on
length ball outside off, steered to backward point

dropped! Shin high full toss on fifth stump slapped back to Shinwari at thigh height crouching to his left in his follow-through. 5/10 on degree of difficulty. Very firm drive but basically right to him. Has to be taken in this context at this level and he shells it badly.
good length ball spinning away on fifth stump line, guided out to the sweeper.
fullish length wide on fifth stump, goes back to punch to the off side, very poor relay by Mujeeb sweeping on the off side.
full and pitching outside leg, tapped gently to deep square leg.
good length ball pitching on fourth stump at 77 kph/48 mph, tapped behind square on the off side.
yorker length landing full on off, dug out to midwicket.
full on fifth stump, driven to long-on.
full on off, defended on the front foot back to Nabi.
good length on fourth stump, goes back to flick through square leg.
good length ball on fourth stump spinning in, chipped uppishly but well short of midwicket in the ring.
good length ball on leg stump and spinning down, misses a flick off the pads to short fine leg.
full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot to cover.
full and wide, Sarfaraz charges and slaps this one-handed tennis backhand style through cover.
fullish length on leg stump, clipped off the pads straight to short fine leg.
full on the stumps, driven firmly but diving stop by Hashmatullah at midwicket.
good length ball on off stump, defended to the left of Shinwari in his follow-through.
short outside off on fifth stump, cut behind point, Mujeeb has plenty of work to do to keep this to two.
short on off, punched to extra cover.
floated full on fourth stump, driven to long-on.
full on fourth stump, pressed forward and nudged behind point.
full on off stump, driven again to long-on with ease.
full on off, clipped through midwicket.
good length on fourth stump, kept his hands back to open the face and run this behind point.
full on fifth stump, driven to Shinwari at extra cover.
short of a length outside off, tapped behind point.
quicker ball flat and full on middle stump, goes back to punch to Rashid.
googly pitches on middle spins away toward off, defended with soft hands to cover.
another googly, too short this time on middle, goes back and reads it off the pitch defending to backward point.
quicker ball on a good length well down leg, he'll have to rebowl.
good length ball on leg stump, goes back and can't flick away.

Rashid's wicket drought is over! Beaten going onto the back foot and given leg before! Good length ball, touch more air, goes back to defend and misses, struck on the knee roll well inside the crease. Only real question for Paul Wilson was did this pitch in line with leg stump. He says yes. Haris is on his way!
good length ball on fourth stump, defended on the back foot to cover.
good length ball pushed to backward point.
short of a length on fifth stump, guided wide of short third man.
full and wide on sixth stump, Imad gropes forward but can't reach the ball, beaten on the turn and bounce.
overpitched wide of off on fifth stump, driven firmly to long off.
fullish length on off stump, defended high on the bat to midwicket.
good length ball spins down leg.
googly pitches on off and spins sharply outside off, Imad chases with his hands.
googly again, goes back and defends on the back foot.

huge shout again! Given not out! My goodness! So close! Pitched very very full on leg stump it appeared to beat Imad playing across. Only doubt was did it pitch in line. Paul Wilson again under pressure along with the Pakistani pair in the middle.
quicker and flatter pitching outside leg and spinning down.
another huge shout! Not out again! Only an inside edge could save him and he did indeed get bat on this playing on the front foot.
good length quicker ball, Imad just gets bat on this going back and short fine leg cuts it off.
quick and full again on middle, clipped to short fine leg.
good length ball on off, guided to third man with open face.
full length ball on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket.
good length ball on the stumps, clipped to deep midwicket.
slower ball lands on a good length on fifth stump, beats Imad poking at it.
another slower ball lands way too short, enough time to adjust and cut to the sweeper.
slower ball lands on a good length on middle, keeps the hands back to pull firm and fine behind square, too much work for deep midwicket to do and it breaks a 10-over boundary drought.
googly lands full outside off on fifth stump and spins away, left alone.
another googly, this time Imad teased into a shot landing very full on fourth stump, beaten.
three googlies in a row, this time pitching on middle on a full length and smothered with a front foot press.
good length ball around leg stump, Imad goes back to flick and misses, stifled lbw shout.
shin high full toss on off, Imad with a nervy drive to mid-off for just a single.

runout! Pakistan are throwing this away! Googly lands way too short and wide on around 7th stump. Sarfaraz cut this behind point for a simple one, the point sweeper Najibullah is the quickest fielder of the XI for Afghanistan and the last guy Sarfaraz should be taking on. He circles around like a Blue Tiger to pounce, fire a sharp relay to Ikram with Sarfaraz five yards short. Never a second run there. Imad wasn't really interested and Sarfaraz only has himself to blame.
full on the stumps, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended off the pads.
full toss at thigh height wide outside off, slapped straight to cover.
yorker length on off stump driven to long-on.
full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot.
full on off, driven to cover.
length ball on the stumps, turned gently into the legside
slightly shorter but no conviction behind that punch shot, straight to mid-off
fuller on the stumps, driven back, the bowler gets a hand to it but can't stop it
flighted outside off, he comes well forward and gets to the pitch to drive through cover
fuller, comes forward and worked off his pads. Hit it softly enough that they had time to sprint back for the second because the fielder was very deep
leading edge falls safe. Tried to turn it again but this one had more revs on it, and it dipped a bit, bounced a tad higher got a leading edge, but it goes to where short mid-off might have been
good length on the stumps, clipped towards mid-on
wide yorker, reaches for it and slaps it to third man
a bit short and he stands back to pull this, bounces to deep midwicket
good length angling into him, tapped to the bowler's left. Softly enough for him to go across and field
drilled. Full toss outside off and he takes full toll, smashes it back past the bowler, to the long-off fence
too full on the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
brave shot! reverse sweep, connects well but straight to short third man
full and straight on off, clipped off his toes to wide long-on
quicker one, a bit shorter, he had to adjust and ends up jabbing it back to the bowler
a bit of an ungainly flick towards deep midwicket off a full one outside off
nicely done. Back of a length outside off and he waits for it and opens the face of the bat to glance it very fine
length ball on the pads, tucked to deep square leg to keep strike
googly, but he reads if off the pitch and ends up dabbing it to short third man
sharp turn, pitches on a length and whizzes past hte bat
huge stride out to get to the pitch and stab it towards long-on
legspinner that time, pitches on middle and turns in, flicked off his pads to deep square
googly again, ends up on the pads, rolls to short fine leg. They burgle a quick single. Rashid not happy with the fielding effort
fuller on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket and they get another two. Very well run, Pakistan are fighting and very much in it
dropped? or fell short? playing against the turn to try and turn it away but gets a leading edge. Fell just short of a diving Shinwari
stays back to cut this from off stump but can't get past point
throws this wider of off and Shadab has to stretch for it, gets it off the toe-end to mid-off
shorter and quicker, goes back to whip this to deep midwicket
down the track, Shinwari sees him coming and shortens the length so he can only push this down to long-off
bad ball to start with full toss outside off and swept hard and true, to the deep square leg fence

in the air and Asghar Afghan has lost it! nerves afflicting both teams. Imad comes down the track and slices it over Asghar at mid-off, who runs back, turns around but has no idea the ball is dropping right beside him
length ball, punched with good timing to deep midwicket
full outside off, has a big slash at it and it takes the outside edge to go to the third man boundary! This is a game-changing over
Imad Wasim is on fire He's putting away every bad ball. Too short and too wide outside off at gentle pace, cuts it fiercely to the point boundary
and now a wide down legside. Gulbadin is having a nightmare
finally bowls a good ball, yorker length on the stumps, but Imad pushes it away to mid-off
fuller on the stumps, defended tentatively into the offside
googly, on a length spinning away, but Imad is more confident now and strokes it to deep point
edged for four. The luck has gone all Pakistan's way. This was a forward defensive push outside off and it takes the edge to third man.

run out at the striker's end. Length ball, whipped against the turn to deep midwicket and for some reason, Shadab thinks there's two there and hares back. But replays confirm the throw is good and the bails are off before he could get back. The match is alive again!
googly beats him all ends up. was pressing forward to defend, hit on the pads
smoked absolutely smoked through cover. Wahab! gets down on one knee and lashes this low full toss, cool as ice.
steered to short third man
good length, dips again, hit to the bowler of the toe end
swing and a miss! length outside off, goes to slash, too close for that
very full on the stumps, flowing drive hit back at the bowler, it pings him on the ankle and races to long-on. He's hurt his ankle too
quicker one, carrom ball at 99kph, Wahab stuck on his crease ends up just about jabbing it away into the offside
fuller outside off, carved to point. Ends a fabulous spell from Mujeeb
goes for the wild heave but misses completely. Leg break on off and turning away
Wahab Riaz is Pakistan's hero. What a nerveless strike. Googly in the slot, he goes down on one knee and smashes it way over deep midwicket. What a hit.
quicker googly, also shorter, chopped down to long-off. There is some scrambling in the field by Afghanistan and that means they can hare back for the second
another googly, another heave that aimed at sending the ball to London. Misses it. The ball goes dangerously close to off stump
reverse sweep! What pressure? Wahab just pulls out that shot and sends it to deep cover. Ungainly in the end but effective
googly on the pads, rolls to short fine leg off the pads but they take a single. Imad will be on strike for the final over
another full toss outside off, flayed through the offside but he has protection in the deep. Terrible bowling by Gulbadin
strays down leg, Wahab doesn't connect with the big heave, so it rolls off his pad to short fine leg

very full outside off, driven fluently to cover, who relays a straight throw to Naib who fumbles it with the batsman hout of his crease. Not only that he lets it slip, and they steal a second. Gulbadin's every nightmare coming alive.

Imad has done it! another full toss outside off, and he keeps icy calm to thread this through cover, bisects the field and sends this to the boundary. Pakistan are roaring and alive in the World Cup 2019. What a win!
